script: I completely understand that taking intensive language classes in person isn't appealing to absolutely everyone. It definitely requires a lot of extra time and financial commitment. That said, I can genuinely see why some people strongly prefer the traditional classroom option. It's undeniably much better for immediate speaking practice and real-time feedback. I personally just need an online learning method that easily fits around my unpredictable work schedule.

options: To politely concede a valid point that contrasts with their own personal preference.
To aggressively argue that online classes are a terrible choice for everyone.
To boast about how much money they save by studying alone at home.
To excitedly announce that they are opening their own language school.
question.prompt: Why does the speaker use the transition 'That said'?

explanation: The speaker uses 'That said' to smoothly pivot from acknowledging one valid viewpoint to introducing a contrasting, but equally valid, perspective.
